news_header: Several villages near the Lewotobi Laki-Laki volcano in Indonesia have been evacuated due to eruptions, resulting in at least 10 deaths and significant damage.
news_text: The Lewotobi Laki-Laki volcano on Flores island, Indonesia, erupted late at night, leading to the evacuation of several villages and thick ash coverage. At least 10 people have died, and lava reached settlements about four kilometers away, damaging homes and causing fires. A power outage and lightning caused panic among residents. The Indonesian National Disaster Management Agency is investigating, and alarm levels have been raised to the highest level, advising people to stay at least seven kilometers away from the volcano. The region is known for having a high concentration of active volcanoes.
